issue.title: Update Multisense ladar and camera values to match hardware

content.raw:
You're right about the number of readings - the MS LIDAR's ranges vector has 1081 elements, so depending on how the Gazebo lidar plugin works it needs 1081 samples and/or a fix to start with a sample at 0 (I'd assume it already starts at the beginning, but who knows! :) ). @scpeters can you check?


Rates above 10Hz do work for matching. ;) Their TODO list is on page 20 of their [drc training slides](https://support.carnegierobotics.com/attachments/token/3cw0d2msfm7exft/?name=MultiSense-SL_DRC_training.pdf).
content.html:
You're right about the number of readings - the MS LIDAR's ranges vector has 1081 elements, so depending on how the Gazebo lidar plugin works it needs 1081 samples and/or a fix to start with a sample at 0 (I'd assume it already starts at the beginning, but who knows! :) ). @scpeters can you check?

Rates above 10Hz do work for matching. ;) Their TODO list is on page 20 of their drc training slides.
